meanings.definition: A rhythmic sound, such as that made by a clock.
meanings.sent1: The ticking of the clock filled the room with a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the ticking of the clock in the quiet house.
meanings.sent3: The ticking of the clock seemed to be in sync with my heartbeat.
meanings.sent4: Time moved forward with each ticking of the clock on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The ticking of the clock echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: The action of ticking, as in a clock.
meanings.sent1: Her gentle ticking of the clock lulled me to sleep.
meanings.sent2: I checked the ticking of the clock to see if it was accurate.
meanings.sent3: The ticking of the clock seemed to be racing against time itself.
meanings.sent4: With each ticking of the clock, I felt the day slipping away.
meanings.sent5: The ticking of the clock marked the passing of each moment.

meanings.definition: A strong, closely woven fabric typically made of cotton or linen.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a beautiful dress using the ticking fabric.
meanings.sent2: The ticking fabric was durable and perfect for upholstery.
meanings.sent3: The ticking fabric added a rustic charm to the room.
meanings.sent4: The ticking fabric felt rough yet comforting against my skin.
meanings.sent5: The ticking fabric had a classic look that never went out of style.
